content: (The following statement was released by the rating agency) NEW YORK  November 16 (Fitch) Fitch Ratings has affirmed Marriott International's (NYSE: MAR) Long-Term Issuer Default Rating (IDR) at 'BBB' and Short-Term IDR at 'F2'. The Rating Outlook remains Positive. Fitch has also affirmed Starwood Hotels & Resorts Worldwide  Inc.'s IDR at 'BBB' and maintained the Positive Rating Outlook. A full list of rating actions follows at the end of this release. KEY RATING DRIVERS The Positive Outlook con

title: Fitch Affirms Marriott at 'BBB'; Maintains Positive Outlook

title: UPDATE 5-Marriott to buy Starwood to create world's biggest hotel chain

content: * Indexes close up: Dow 1.38 pct  S&P 1.49 pct  Nasdaq 1.15 pct   (Updates to close)
name: Marriott International
title: US STOCKS-Wall St surges over 1 pct  looks past Paris attacks

name: Marriott International
title: US STOCKS-Wall Street jumps 1 pct  looks beyond Paris attacks

content: Nov 16 U.S. stock index futures were slightly higher on Monday  recovering from losses over the weekend after Friday's deadly attacks in Paris that killed about 130 people.
name: Marriott International
title: US STOCKS-Futures inch up  reversing losses after Paris attacks

content: Nov 16 Marriott International Inc will buy Starwood Hotels & Resorts Worldwide Inc in a cash and stock deal valued at $12.2 billion to create the world's largest hotel chain.
name: Marriott International
title: Marriott to buy Starwood Hotels in $12.2 bln deal

content: HONG KONG U.S.-based hotel chain Marriott International Inc and Alibaba Group's online travel booking platform announced a tie-up on Monday  joining a flurry of rivals expanding their presence in China to cater to the country's growing upper-middle class.
name: Marriott International
title: Marriott  Alitrip tie-up to let Chinese travellers book online

content: Nov 8 Marriott International Inc and Alibaba Group's online travel booking platform  Alitrip  have tied up to let Chinese travelers book hotel rooms online and on their mobile phones through a directly operated online flagship store.
name: Marriott International
title: Marriott  Alipay tie up to let Chinese travelers book online

content: SAO PAULO  Oct 6 U.S. hotel chain Marriott International Inc plans to almost triple the number of its hotels in Brazil  in a bet that the nation's worst recession in a quarter century will be short-lived.
name: Marriott International
title: Marriott to triple Brazil hotels on hopes of short-lived recession

content: BERLIN  March 3 Hotels group Marriott  plans to double the number of hotels it has in Europe by 2020  with growth led by its new Moxy brand aimed at travellers on a budget.
name: Marriott International
title: Marriott eyes European expansion led by Moxy budget brand

content: NEW DELHI/MUMBAI London's landmark Grosvenor House hotel has been put up for sale after its owner  part of troubled Indian conglomerate Sahara which has been trying to raise funds for its jailed boss Subrata Roy  was placed into administration by creditors.
name: Marriott International
title: Sahara's Grosvenor House hotel in London put up for sale

content: NEW DELHI/MUMBAI  March 3 London's landmark Grosvenor House hotel has been put up for sale after its owner  part of troubled Indian conglomerate Sahara which has been trying to raise funds for its jailed boss Subrata Roy  was placed into administration by creditors.
name: Marriott International
title: UPDATE 1-Sahara's Grosvenor House hotel in London put up for sale

content: Hilton Worldwide Holdings Inc   owner of the Waldorf Astoria hotel brand  forecast lower-than-expected earnings for the first quarter as a strong dollar makes it more expensive for foreigners to travel to the United States. | Video
name: Marriott International
title: Hilton forecast disappoints  Marriott profit beats

content: * Hilton expects 1st-qtr earnings/shr $0.10-$0.12 vs est. $0.15
name: Marriott International
title: UPDATE 5-Hilton forecast disappoints  Marriott profit beats

content: WASHINGTON  Jan 27 The U.S. Federal Communications Commission on Tuesday warned hotels and other entities against blocking personal Wi-Fi access  or hot spots  saying it was illegal and could incur heavy fines.
name: Marriott International
title: U.S. FCC warns against blocking personal Wi-Fi access
